summary: This document contains two sealed federal court orders authorizing the FBI to obtain extensive location and communication data for two target cellphones as part of an investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and others. One phone is subscribed to 'Terramar Project, Inc.' and the other to 'G Max'. The orders cite concerns about flight risk and witness intimidation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of an ongoing FBI investigation for suspected violations of federal statutes including conspiracy, sex trafficking, and perjury.

events.title: Court Issues Sealed Surveillance Warrants
events.description: A United States Magistrate Judge signs two sealed warrants authorizing the FBI to collect prospective and historical location data, toll records, and pen register information for two target cellphones.

keyFacts: The FBI obtained a sealed court order to track a cellphone subscribed to 'Terramar Project, Inc.', an entity linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
The FBI simultaneously obtained a sealed court order to track a cellphone subscribed in the name 'G Max', strongly indicating it belonged to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The investigation targeted Ghislaine Maxwell and others for suspected violations including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371), sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. §§ 2422, 2423(a)), and perjury (18 U.S.C. § 1623).
The court found reason to believe notification of the warrants would cause flight from prosecution, witness intimidation, or jeopardize the investigation, leading to a one-year non-disclosure order.
The warrants sought extensive data including real-time GPS location, historical cell site info from June 1, 2020, and all call detail records for a 45-day period.
